page.title: 11Housing
page.content: There is a nucleus in all villages of houses built before 1939.But the builing boom in housing began here in the late 1950s,accelerated in the '60s & 70's but has slowed down as available building land has become scarcer.The improvement in roads,especially the building of the M40, has made this a desirable commuter area. In a survey of 175 houses two thirds are on planned estates and more than 90% are owner-occupied.Almost a half are detached,35% are semi-detached and 18% are terraced houses.78% of the houses have either 7,8 or 9 rooms,some newer ones incorporating 2 bathrooms and 2 garages.Many are built as open- plan estates,though some owners have planted hedges,following the older trend to have more privacy. Possibly more land will be released for housing in the near future.
